subject: Programming
title: Composition Over Inheritance
description: Learn Composition Over Inheritance in one minute.

hook.text: Inheritance creates rigid hierarchies. Change the parent and every child might break.

buildup.text: A Dog extends Animal extends LivingThing. Three levels deep and you're already confused.

discovery.text: Composition assembles behavior from small, independent parts. Swap a part without rebuilding the whole.

twist.text: The Gang of Four said this in 1994. Thirty years later, developers still reach for inheritance first.

climax.text: Compose small, focused objects. Inherit only when there's a genuine is-a relationship.

punchline.text: Build with Lego bricks, not family trees.

quiz.question: Why is composition preferred over inheritance?
options: It creates more flexible, swappable behavior
